div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2306 Constantine, (anc. Cirta), 300 km. E (258) of Algiers, Algeria, 1912 Burial: 1st cent. B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 237 AR Massalia: 12 dr. Celtiberian: 75 den. Athens: 14 New Style tetradr. Roman Rep.: 136 den. (to c. 79 B.C.) Disposition: Constantine Charrier, Description des monnaies de la Numidie et de la Mauretanie (Macon, 1912), p. 10, note 1 (poor data: Athens given as "Athens or Carthage") Note by E. S. G. Robinson (1 Athens seen)
